concept_data.title: European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority
concept_data.category_name: EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.category_full: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service

summary: The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) is a key regulatory body within the European Union, established to enhance the stability and transparency of the insurance and pensions sectors. EIOPA's mandate includes the supervision of insurance companies and pension funds, ensuring compliance with EU regulations and directives. It aims to protect policyholders and beneficiaries by promoting sound risk management practices and fostering a single market for financial services. EIOPA also plays a critical role in developing regulatory frameworks and guidelines, contributing to the overall financial stability of the EU, and facilitating cooperation among national supervisory authorities.
